New Records: Shohei Ohtani hit 51 home runs and 51 stolen bases in one game
Shohei Ohtani became the first 50-homer, 50-stolen base player in MLB history
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani was 6-for-6 with three home runs, two doubles, 10 RBIs and two stolen bases
Shohei Ohtani hit a third homer against a position player
Post-Match Reflections: Shohei Ohtani expressed relief and respect for his peers after the game
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts called Ohtani 'one of one' for his achievement
Miscellaneous Highlights: Miami manager Skip Schumaker showed respect for Ohtani, stating it would be a bad move to intentionally walk him
Others: Shawn Green held the Dodgers' season home run record of 49 until Ohtani surpassed it
Former Dodger Shawn Green called Ohtani the 'greatest player who ever lived'
Ohtani leads the NL in home runs and RBIs, second in the majors to Aaron Judge
